Posts.Content: Lharry wrote: Any suggestions on relief for Seroma? I had surgery (lumpectomy)a week ago tomorrow and my breast feels uncomfortably full. Dx 7/20/2015, DCIS, Left, 5cm, Stage 0, Grade 2 Surgery 7/21/2015 Lumpectomy: Left Dx 7/25/2015, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 9/7/2015 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Seroma Lharry meezers3

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2015 09:16PM Lharry wrote: Boy do I wish there was SOMETHING that could be done to relieve this a bit! I am very uncomfortable with it. I spoke to breast advocate and she said that the doctor likely won't do anything with it, because it isn't showing any signs of infection or anything. How long did yours last? It has been a week since my surgery. I literally hear the sloshing when I stand up from sitting! Do you think me going for nightly casual walks in the neighborhood have anything to do with it? It is awefully humid outside, and I do sweat when I'm walking. I just am hoping for anything that could relieve this full, pressure, feeling like I'm carrying around a large water balloon feeling. I'm not digging this whole breast cancer thing right now! (who ever does, right?)
Posts.Title: Seroma Lharry meezers3

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2015 08:07PM Lharry wrote: Do you recall how long it took for it to resolve on its own Italychick? I guess I'm just a little impatient and the sloshing truly bothers me! It has been a 9 days for me, and it hasn't gone down at all yet. I'm learning to just deal with it. But, every bump in the road hurts still!
Posts.Title: Seroma Lharry meezers3
Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2016 01:28PM Lharry wrote: I just found this topic, and am too impatient to read through all the posts, but after having read a few, it seems to me that when you refer to PMPS, you are talking about constant pain. Is this correct? I don't have constant pain, but occasional pains. But just a few minutes ago, I had a SHARP pain that literally felt like a hot knife had stabbed me! And I can honestly say that I can withstand pain fairly easy, but this had me in tears. It only lasted a quick minute, and was gone completely. Needless to say, it scared me! Anyone else experience this? Is it likely to continue? Is there anything I should do
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13
